result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob R Miller

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on April 24, 2023 at 09:00 am.

9:48 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob R Miller appeared by video, in custody from Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court for Jacob R Miller. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

Branch 1 for further scheduling.

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 10:59 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Jacob R Miller appeared by video, in custody from the Washburn County Jail.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant quashed. State requests $250 Cash Bond (History of failing to appear). Court orders $250 Cash Bond.
RTN: 8/17/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
Return on warrant on August 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(Case called at 9:55 AM) Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob R Miller not in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Jacob R Miller. 
Warrant ordered.

(9:46 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob R Miller does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Jacob R Miller. 
Attorney Linzmeier has no information for the defendant's non-appearance.
State requests warrant. Court orders warrant.
(10:20 AM case recalled.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob R Miller appeared via audio only. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier does not appear in court or via Zoom. 
Court orders warrant is quashed.
Court informs defendant to get in contact with Attorney Linzmeier and provide her with new dates.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on May 16, 2022 at 2:45 pm.
Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
